message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about tools that can be used to study objects closely. In order to study a flower closely, an enlarger would be the most appropriate tool. An enlarger is a device used in photography to project and enlarge small objects or details onto a larger surface. Options (B) and (C) are unrelated to studying objects closely. Option (D) is incorrect because a telescope is used to observe objects that are far away, not close up.

This question requires knowledge about tools that can be used to study objects in detail. An enlarger is a device that magnifies small objects, allowing us to study them more closely. Option (B) is incorrect because a fork is not a tool used for studying objects closely. Option (C) is incorrect because a mirror only reflects light and does not allow us to study objects in detail. Option (D) is incorrect because a telescope is used for viewing objects far away, not for studying them up close.

Option (B) is incorrect because a fork is not a tool used for studying objects. Option (C) is incorrect because a mirror reflects an image but does not provide a closer look. Option (D) is incorrect because a telescope is used to observe objects in the distance, not to study them up close.
